result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda R. Bildeau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant must attend and successfully complete a parenting program.

The defendant must comply with any and all family court or tribal court orders as related to her children.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

All monies will be collected through the Clerk of Court.

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Defendant Amanda R. Bildeau in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Amanda R. Bildeau in custody from FC jail.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:27 PM. State here for sentencing after revocation. Bildeau and Joy have copy of revocation, no errors or inaccuracies. State - 91 days credit, asks for 6 months in FC jail for reasons as stated on the record. Joy makes statement and follows recommendation of the State. Bildeau makes statement, remorseful. Court - has reviewed packet - court sentences to 5 months in the FC jail on each count, concurrent to each other, court orders 30 DTP/CO remaining balance paid through the clerk of courts office, gives credit for 91 days, huber allowed, eligible for good time and community service under 973.03. Right to appeal.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 10, 2018 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Amanda R. Bildeau in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:34 AM. Called 16CM108 and 16CM61. Joy needs time to go thru plea forms. Recess at 9:35 to do that. Recalled at 9:45 AM with same appearances. State - resolved - 16CM108 - defendant would plead g/nc to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, counts #3 and #4 are to be DRI, withhold sentence and place on probation for 24 months with conditions of: court costs on each count, AODA and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 35 hours of community service, comply with any and all family court or tribal court order as related to her children, attend and successfully complete a parenting program, 16CM161 - amend count #1 to City of Crandon ordinance of DC with a $300.00 fine plus costs, #2 - amend to county ordinance of BJ with $300.00 fine plus costs. Bildeau and Joy agree. Court - 16CM108 - dismisses and reads in counts #3 and #4. Bildeau pleads NC to counts #1 and #2 as alleged. Court - 16CM161 - amends count #1 to City of Crandon ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $300.00 fine plus costs totalling $582.50 - 60 DTP/CO; amends count #2 to county ordinance of bail jumping, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $300.00 plus costs totalling $582.50 - 60 DTP/CO. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea and adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Bildeau withholds statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CM108, counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: court costs on each count - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 35 hours of community service, comply with any and all family court or tribal court order as related to her children, attend and successfully complete a parenting program, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Amanda R. Bildeau in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:45 AM. Called 16CM108 and recalled 16CM161. Joy informs the Court that she was not aware of her case that was scheduled this morning (16CM161). Court will quash the warrant on 16CM161. Joy waives reading of that complaint and enters NG pleas to all counts on that matter. Joy - 16CM108 - not quite resolved yet. State - pleas to all 4 counts and place on probation for 2 years on all counts. Bildeau is not willing to accept that deal at this point. Joy has gone over the offer with the defendant. Court - bond on 16CM161 - $500.00 signature bond.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial on October 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Amanda R. Bildeau in court with attorney Jeffery Joy who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:27 AM. Joy has complaint but has not gone over it with the defendant, waives reading of it as Court has previously gone thru the complaint with her, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
No consumption of alcohol. Must comply with any conditions as set forth by the Tribal Court.

Defendant Amanda R. Bildeau in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:37 AM. Bildeau has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Court is aware that the defendant has Jeff Joy on her other case. Bildeau understands and will contact Jeff Joy. Court sets for AIA. State - bond- $500.00 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and enroll and participate in a parenting class. Bildeau states she is already doing that. Defendant to provide documents to Court in regards to the Tribal Court rulings.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
